Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AR-1-S (Arenicin-1 analog C to S, Arg-rich, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (90.48%) toArenicin-1R: 29%, V: 24%, S=W: 10%.Activity: active against E. coli KCTC 1682 (MIC 16 uM), P. aeruginosa KCTC 1637 (MIC 8 uM), S.aureus KCTC 1621 (MIC 4 uM), and S. epidermidis KCTC 1917 (MIC 8 uM).SAR: C to S changes led to antibacterial activity decrease by 2-4 fold (4 fold P. aeruginosa).
Literature Information.Author: Lee JU, Kang DI, Zhu WL, Shin SY, Hahm KS, Kim Y.2007
Literature Information.Title: Solution structures and biological functions of the antimicrobial peptide, arenicin-1, and its linear derivative.
